attributes.action: abolish the tie to pub companies and allow tenants to buy beer elsewhere
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Pub companies are charging their tenants an astonishing 65% more for their beer than is necessary. The true cost of a barrel at the moment from John smiths for 12 gallons is aroun £35-£40. Pub companies like Enterprise Inns, Admiral Taverns and Greene King are charging around £109 for a barrel. The only real cost to the pub company is transportation provided by Scottish & Newcastle, and it in no way justifies 65% difference. This must end now. And give publicans the choice to purchase beer elsewhere. Thus saving revenue for them and reduce the cost of a pint and bring back trade to our local pubs.
